titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur Mitchell Collection,

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion September 26, 2019

repository.corpname: Columbia University LibrariesRare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Ballet dancer, choreographer, and director who was the first African American to become a principal dancer with a major ballet company, New York City Ballet. He later founded the Dance Theatre of Harlem (1969).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memorabilia, business records, photographs, memoranda, documents, etc.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Material currently listed in this finding aid is processed and available for use in the reading room. The collection is still being processed at this time, and all other material is CLOSED until processed. Unprocessed material includes various personal records, posters, memorabilia, audiovisual materials, and three-dimensional objects.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Arthur Mitchell Collection; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection-level record describing unprocessed material made public in summer 2018 as part of the Hidden Collections initiative.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
